questions.question: 1. Various substances can be used as anticoagulants, including natural polysaccharides. Select a natural polysaccharide among the substances listed below.
2. In a vertical position, the patient loses his balance and almost falls down, when his eyes are closed. What part of his brain is likely to be damaged?

answers.text: D. Precentral gyrus of the cerebral cortex

questions.question: 3. An unconscious man was brought into the admission room of a hospital. Objectively, his skin is cold, his pupils are narrowed, he has Cheyne-Stokes type of abnormal respiration, the blood pressure is low, the bladder is full. The man has been diagnosed with morphine poisoning. What drug must be used as a morphine antagonist in this case?

4. A 64-year-old woman has suffered a pathological fracture of the humerus. Biopsy detects atypical plasma cells. X-ray shows tumor-like formations at the fracture site. What disease is likely in this case?
5. A patient presents with impaired water reabsorption in the kidneys, which is directly related to disturbed secretion of a certain hormone. Name this hormone.
6. A hypertensive crisis occurred in a 68-year-old woman with a long history of essential hypertension. What drug should be prescribed in this case as hypotensive therapy?

7. A woman underwent surgery for a uterine tumor. A macropreparation shows a spongy variegated node that was located in the myometrium. Histology reveals large light-colored epithelial cells, among which there are many dark-colored polymorphic cells. There is no stroma. The vessels look like cavities lined with tumor cells. There are multiple hemorrhages. What tumor was detected in this case?
8. The breakdown of glycogen in the liver is stimulated by glucagon. What secondary messenger (intermediary) forms in the cell in this case?

9. A biopsy material obtained from the bronchial mucosa of a 50-year-old patient with a 20-year-long history of chronic bronchitis revealed thinning of the mucosa, cyst-like transformation of the mucous glands, and foci, where prismatic epithelium was replaced with stratified squamous epithelium. What pathological process is most likely in this case?
10. A man with a disorder of cerebral circulation has problems with swallowing liquid foods. What part of his brain is damaged?
11. After the blood supply to the brain was impaired, a person has lost the ability to write letters and digits. In what part of the brain did the pathology occur?

12. A patient with bronchopulmonary aspergillosis developed allergic rhinitis. Enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay detects elevated levels of IgE. What cell type expresses receptors for IgE on its cell surface, which stimulates the cell to respond to parasites, such as worms?
13. Examination detects lymphopenia in a patient, who has been taking glucocorticoids for a long time. How can the functional state of the patient's immune system be characterized in this case?
14. In an experiment, certain nuclei of the hypothalamus were destroyed in homeothermic animals, which resulted in them being unable to maintain their body temperature. What nuclei were destroyed?

15. A 35-year-old woman came for a follow-up visit two weeks after a case of COVID-19. ECG detects a decrease in the voltage of the waves, the P wave is unchanged and connected to the QRS complex, the duration of the PQ interval is 0.32 seconds. What type of arrhythmia did the patient develop?
16. When studying an isolated excitatory cell, it was determined that the cell’s threshold stimulation force had significantly decreased. What could have caused this?

answers.text: A. Blockade of energy production in the cell
B. Activation of membrane sodium channels
C. Inactivation of membrane sodium channels
D. Inactivation of membrane calcium channels
E. Activation of membrane potassium channels

questions.question: 17. A 16-year-old adolescent came to a doctor complaining of itching between his fingers and on the abdomen, which intensifies at night. Examination of the skin revealed thin gray stripes and a fine rash. What is the causative agent of this disease?
18. During immediate allergic reactions, degranulation of basophilic granulocytes that secrete bioactive substances occurs. Select from the list one such substance.
19. The corpus luteum forms during the luteal phase of the menstrual cycle. This temporary endocrine gland stimulates the synthesis of a certain hormone. What hormone is it?
20. A woman with I (O) Rh-blood group married a man with IV (AB) Rh+ blood group. What blood type and Rh factor can be expected in the children of this couple (excluding the Bombay phenotype)?
21. Measuring the transaminase activity is widely used to diagnose the damage to internal organs. The active form of a certain vitamin is a cofactor of these enzymes. Name this vitamin.
22. Tubocurarine chloride was used during dislocation reduction in a patient. Soon the patient developed overdose symptoms. What drug should be used to eliminate these symptoms?
23. A number of blood and connective tissue cells participate in the synthesis and release of inflammatory mediators. In what cells is interleukin-1 synthesized?
24. As a result of cerebral hemorrhage, the patient developed impaired speech perception (sensory aphasia). What brain structure is likely to be damaged in this case?
25. The causative agent of hepatitis D (δ agent) is a defective virus that can only replicate in the cells that are already infected with:

26. A 36-year-old woman has a moon-shaped face, upper body obesity, stretch marks on the anterior abdominal wall, hirsutism, hyperglycemia, and glycosuria. These symptoms are characteristic of the following pathology:

27. During the viroscopy of the cell monolayer infected with an infectious material, a medical laboratory scientist made the diagnosis of respiratory syncytial virus infection. What changes does this virus cause in the cell culture?

answers.text: B. Total destruction of the cell monolayer
C. The presence of Babes-Negri bodies

questions.question: 28. A team of medical students researches the phases of the cell cycle. During one of the mitotic phases, the cell is nearly done dividing, the chromosomes decondense and two nuclei begin to form around them. Which of the following phases most likely takes place in the cell?
29. A man was hospitalized with provisional diagnosis of acute pancreatitis. What enzyme activity must be measured in the patient’s blood and urine to confirm this diagnosis?

30. A 47-year-old woman has interphalangeal and metacarpophalangeal joints that can be easily dislocated or subluxated and a characteristic deviation of the fingers that resembles "walrus flippers". Microscopy reveals proliferation of synovial villi, cartilage destruction, and pannus formation. What disease causes these pathological changes?

31. In an experiment on a spinal frog, after increasing the skin area treated with an acid solution, the time of the protective flexion reflex decreased from 10 to 6 seconds. What mechanism underlies the reduction of the reflex time?

answers.text: D. Excitation radiation by divergent nerve circuits

questions.question: 32. A 36-year-old man has been diagnosed with herpes simplex of the mucosa of the lips. As a part of complex therapy, the doctor prescribed him a topical drug with antiviral effect. What drug is it?

33. Autopsy of the body of a deceased person detected systemic enlargement of the lymph nodes with formation of tumor conglomerates. The spleen is enlarged and variegated on section: against the red background of the pulp, there are multiple small yellowish-white and grayish foci. What disease most likely corresponds with these changes?
34. A patient, who works in an underground mine, has developed pulmonary fibrosis. What can be detected by spirometric testing in this case?

answers.text: A. Decreased vital capacity of the lungs
E. Increased vital capacity of the lungs

questions.question: 35. Examination of a man detected athetosis and chorea. The doctor suspects damage to the following structures of his central nervous system:

36. A test animal received a concentrated solution of sodium chloride intravenously, which caused a decrease in its reabsorption in the kidney tubules. This phenomenon can be caused by a change in the secretion of a certain hormone. Name this change.

answers.text: E. Decreased secretion of natriuretic factor

questions.question: 37. A 50-year-old patient complaining of weight loss and weakness presents with hypoglycemia and hyperinsulinemia in the blood. An additional examination detected a tumor of the islets of Langerhans. What cell atypism causes increased insulin synthesis in this case?

38. A 55-year-old patient is being monitored by an endocrinologist for disturbed endocrine function of the pancreas, which manifests as a decrease in glucagon levels in the blood. What pancreatic cells are dysfunctional in this case?

answers.text: A. δ-cells of the islets of Langerhans
B. α-cells of the islets of Langerhans
C. PP cells of the islets of Langerhans
D. β-cells of the islets of Langerhans
E. δ-cells of the islets of Langerhans

questions.question: 39. In an 8-year-old child with purulent otitis media, the infection has spread from the tympanic cavity to the jugular bulb. This complication develops if on of the walls of the tympanic cavity has thinned. What wall is most likely to have an anomaly in this child?
40. A player injured his knee joint during a match and was diagnosed with a fracture of the bone that is located within the thick of the quadriceps tendon of the thigh. What type of bone is it?
41. As a result of physical exertion, the person's blood clotting rate became faster, because the levels of a certain hormone increased in the blood. Name this hormone.

42. When performing an anterior mediastinal incision on the skin and fascia of the neck for an urgent tracheotomy, the doctor should keep in mind that there is a risk of damaging the following blood vessel:

43. A newborn with asphyxia was administered a drug for direct stimulation of the respiratory center. This drug has anti-inflammatory, anti-allergic, and broncholytic effects. It also inhibits the cerebral cortex and does not cause seizures. What drug has such characteristics?

44. S. aureus cultures were isolated during bacteriology of sour cream samples. What should be done to prove the etiological role of an isolated S. aureus culture as the causative agent of food poisoning that occurred in a group of consumers that were eating this sour cream?

answers.text: D. Measuring the plasma coagulase activity

questions.question: 45. A patient developed arterial hypertension, tachyarrhythmia, and persistent disturbances of blood circulation in the heart muscle. What drug should be prescribed for a patient with such a pathology?

46. Autopsy of the body of a 1.5-year-old child revealed a hemorrhagic rash, moderate hyperemia and edema of the nasopharyngeal mucosa, small hemorrhages in the mucosa and internal organs, markedly dystrophic changes in the liver and myocardium, acute necrotizing nephrosis, and massive hemorrhages in the adrenal glands. These changes are characteristic of the following disease:

47. A patient with type 2 diabetes mellitus has been prescribed a drug that, besides a hypoglycemic effect, has a hypocholesterolemic effect as well. This drug is a sulfonylurea derivative. What drug is it?

48. On the second day after the development of a transmural myocardial infarction, the patient developed a sharp drop in systolic blood pressure to 60 mm Hg, tachycardia of 140/min., dyspnea, and loss of consciousness. What mechanism is the leading one in the pathogenesis of the developed shock?

answers.text: A. Decreased stroke volume of the heart
B. Decreased volume of the circulating blood
C. Intoxication with necrotic decay products
E. Anaphylactic reaction to myocardial proteins

questions.question: 49. A patient complains of frequent bleeding from the gums. Blood test detects deficiency of blood coagulation factor II (prothrombin). What phase of blood coagulation is primarily disturbed in this patient?
50. A surgeon performs an operation on the sigmoid colon, stopping the bleeding from aa. Sigmoideae. They are the branches of the following artery:
51. The upper limbs of a person standing upright at rest are slightly flexed. What causes such position of the limbs?

answers.text: A. Reflex from vestibular receptors of the vestibular system
B. Reflex from muscle spindles when stretching the biceps muscle
D. Antagonistic reflex on the part of extended lower limbs
E. Tonic influence of the limbic structures and neocortex

questions.question: 52. In a patient with anemia, the levels of protoporphyrin IX increased in erythrocytes. What mineral element is deficient in this case, causing this pathology?
53. A 55-year-old patient underwent a kidney transplantation. What immunotropic agent should be prescribed in this case?

54. In an experiment, pluripotent embryonic stem cells were obtained from a human blastocyst. Over the course of the next several months, they formed millions of new cells in a nutrient medium at the laboratory. What is the name of the process of multiple cell renewal?
55. What will be caused by stimulation of the carotid sinus baroreceptors in an experiment on a dog?

56. A 35-year-old man has been hospitalized with complaints of a runny nose and headache that last for 5 days already. After examination, he was diagnosed with maxillary sinusitis (inflammation of the maxillary sinus). Through what nasal passage did the infection reach this sinus?

57. A 43-year-old man was hospitalized with complaints of fever with chills, loss of appetite, malaise, diarrhea, and diffuse abdominal pain, observed for the last week. The fever started slowly and gradually increased to the current 39.8°C. The blood pressure is 110/70 mm Hg. Objectively, the tongue is coated, the spleen is enlarged, and there is a roseola rash on the abdomen. The Widal agglutination test to O-antigen is positive with a titer of 1:200. What microorganism is the most likely cause of the patient's condition in this case?

58. A 7-year-old girl has been hospitalized with a high temperature and complaints of a sore throat and general weakness. The doctor suspected diphtheria and gave the instructions to obtain the material from the child’s pharynx and isolate a pure culture of the causative agent. What is crucial in this case for the confirmation of the diagnosis?

answers.text: A. Detection of volutin granules in the causative agent
B. Hemolytic ability of the pathogen

questions.question: 59. A patient was hospitalized with the provisional diagnosis of diphyllobothriasis. What food products could have caused this disease?

60. Autopsy of the body of a 40-year-old man detected a dense subpleural area 1.5 cm in diameter with clear borders in the third segment of the right lung. The affected area is surrounded with whitish fibrous tissue and has crumbling white-yellow areas on section. What can be characterized by the presence of such a lesion focus?
61. A tricuspid valve defect was detected in a patient. Where is it located?

answers.text: A. Between the right atrium and right ventricle
B. Between the left atrium and left ventricle
C. Opening of the coronary sinus
D. Opening of the pulmonary trunk

questions.question: 62. Histology of a lymph node revealed numerous enlarged lymphoid follicles with large germinal centers that have a conspicuous proliferation of mitotic figures. What is indicated by these changes?

answers.text: C. Antigen stimulation with follicular hyperplasia

questions.question: 63. In an experiment, the threshold stimulation force for the cells of various tissues was studied. Where was it the smallest?

answers.text: A. Motor neurons of the spinal cord

questions.question: 64. In the practice of emergency therapy and resuscitation, medical conditions accompanied by edema of brain cells are often encountered. To combat this condition, patients need to be administered substances with a certain effect. What effect do these substances have?

answers.text: A. They change the acid-alkaline balance of the blood
B. They lower the systemic arterial pressure
C. They reduce the central venous pressure
D. They reduce the volume of the circulating blood
E. They increase the colloid osmotic blood pressure

questions.question: 65. The study of a blood smear obtained from a patient with an inflammatory process detects a large number of round cells with a segmented nucleus (three or more segments) and fine pink-violet granulation in the cytoplasm. What blood cells were detected?

66. The number of ATP molecules, formed as a result of the oxidation of various substrates in the mitochondrial respiratory chain, is determined by the value of the oxidative phosphorylation coefficient. How is it calculated?

67. After ligation of one of the branches of the coronary arteries in a dog, the dog developed a myocardial infarction, accompanied by the phenomena of resorption-necrotic syndrome. What is the most characteristic sign of the development of this syndrome?

answers.text: A. Increased blood levels of creatine kinase
B. Increased blood levels of catecholamines

questions.question: 68. A bioterrorist has mailed an envelope with a powder that is suspected to contain anthrax pathogen. This envelope can remain dangerous for a long time, because anthrax pathogen:
69. A 60-year-old woman has congestive heart failure with increased cardiac preload. What bioactive substance will be secreted by the heart in this case?
70. A doctor prescribed an analgesic to a patient for toothache relief. This analgesic does not irritate the lining of the alimentary canal and has no ulcerogenic effect. Name this drug.

71. Examination of the biopsy material detects a granuloma consisting of lymphocytes, plasma cells, macrophages with a foamy cytoplasm (Mikulicz cells), and a large number of hyaline spheres. What disease can be suspected in this case?
72. A patient has an asymmetrically distorted face and a dry eye. What nerve is likely to be damaged in this case?
73. A mixed helminthic infestation, consisting of intestinal ascarids and hepatic trematodes, has been detected in a man. What anthelmintic should be prescribed in this case?
74. A patient, who underwent a long-term glucocorticoid treatment, presents with gastric ulcers. What mechanism is the main one in their development?

answers.text: A. Decreased tone of the parasympathetic nervous system
B. Increased secretion and acidity of gastric juice
C. Increased production of prostaglandins E1 and E2
D. Decreased levels of histamine in the gastric mucosa
E. Increased tone of the sympathetic nervous system

questions.question: 75. Vitamin A deficiency causes impaired twilight vision. What cells have this receptor function?
76. Histology of a skin tumor detects adipose tissue particles of varying size, separated by irregular layers of connective tissue. What disease can be characterized by such pathological changes?

77. After a compression bandage was applied to a hand injury, the patient developed edema of the fingers, cyanosis, and a decrease in the skin temperature. What type of peripheral circulatory disorder has caused these phenomena?

78. A man has a smoothed out right nasolabial fold and widened right palpebral fissure (the patient cannot close his eye because the eyelids won’t close). There are problems with talking and chewing (food becomes stuck between the cheek and teeth). What nerve is affected?
79. A doctor prescribed sodium valproate as an antiepileptic agent to a patient with grand mal seizures. What is the mechanism of action of this drug?

answers.text: A. Increases the activity of hippocampal neurons
B. Changes the activity of serotonin receptors
D. Blocks calcium channels and increases dopamine levels in the brain
E. Blocks sodium channels and increases GABA levels in the brain

questions.question: 80. The causative agent of tuberculosis can exist both intracellularly and extracellularly, as well as in caseous necrosis. What drug can have a harmful effect on Mycobacterium tuberculosis of any localization?

81. A 19-year-old patient complains of diarrhea. As a part of complex therapy, the doctor prescribed the patient an antidiarrheal drug that stimulates opioid receptors in the intestine. What drug was prescribed for this patient?

82. The only indication for narcotic analgesics (morphine, trimperidine) is acute intense pain that is life-threatening for the patient. Why does this group of drugs have such limited indications for practical use?

83. The mother of a 2-year-old boy brought him to a hospital complaining of enlargement of her child’s scrotum. After examination, the child was diagnosed with hydrocele testis (fluid accumulation between the testicular membranes). What tunic of the testicle contains this fluid?
84. A child with hemorrhagic syndrome was diagnosed with hemophilia B. What coagulation factor is deficient in this case, causing this type of hemophilia in the patient?

85. A patient presents with tachycardia, increased basal metabolic rate and body temperature, weight loss, and increased excitability. These disorders are caused by the increased secretion of hormones in the:
86. Antibiotics (streptomycin, erythromycin, chloramphenicol) are used to treat infectious bacterial diseases. What stage of protein synthesis in the microbial cell do they inhibit?

87. All nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs can damage the gastric mucosa. To find the substances that do not cause this complication, it is necessary to know what it is associated with. To reduce the severity of this complication, the drug’s effect on a certain molecular substrate must be reduced. Name this molecular substrate.
88. During the medical examination of students, they underwent a Mantoux test. What specific factors cause a positive reaction, if they are present?
89. A person at rest presents with significantly increased work of the inspiratory muscles. What can cause this phenomenon?

answers.text: A. Narrowing of the respiratory tract

questions.question: 90. In practically healthy individuals, moderate physical exertion causes an increase in the systolic pressure and a slight decrease in the diastolic pressure. What causes such changes?

answers.text: A. Increased force of cardiac contractions and relaxation of the arterioles due to the effect of lactic acid
B. Increased renin release due to a decreased blood supply to the kidneys
C. Increased force and rate of cardiac contractions
D. Increased tone of the arterioles and increased volume of the blood circulating
E. Increased volume of the circulating blood

questions.question: 91. A patient with alkaptonuria has signs of arthritis and ochronosis. What substance accumulates in the joints in this case, causing pain?

92. Wernicke-Korsakoff syndrome often develops in chronic alcoholics, who have a low-vitamin diet. Decreased transketolase activity can be observed in the course of this disease, because a certain vitamin is deficient. What vitamin is it?

93. Examination of a patient shows the following: blood pressure – 180/110 mm Hg, heart rate – 95/min. X-ray detects narrowing of one of the renal arteries. What system was activated, causing the hypertensive state in this patient?
94. A patient needs emergency botulism prophylaxis. What should be used for this purpose?

95. A child has 3 copies of chromosome 18, which resulted in characteristic cranial elongation from front to back, maldevelopments of the musculoskeletal system, fused fingers, and maldevelopments of skeletal muscles. What hereditary pathology is observed in this child?
96. A person's diet contains a large amount of carbohydrates. What structures can be detected in the cytoplasm of hepatocytes in this case?

answers.text: A. Increased number of free ribosomes
B. One big drop of fat

questions.question: 97. Biotin plays an important role in the metabolism of carbohydrates and lipids. In what type of reactions does it take part?

98. Acetylsalicylic acid was prescribed to a woman diagnosed with ischemic heart disease. The antiaggregant (antiplatelet) effect of this drug is based on the synthesis of a certain endogenous substance.3 What endogenous substance is it?
99. A man suffers from cortical blindness. In this case, thrombosis developed in the following artery:

100. A 26-year-old patient complains of muscle pain, seizures, muscle weakness, and red urine, observed after minor physical exertion. Muscle biopsy detected accumulation of glycogen in the muscles. No changes were detected during liver biopsy. What disease is most likely in the patient?

101. A 32-year-old woman complains of infertility, irregular menstrual cycle, chronic acne, and growth of hair on the ovaries. Bimanual examination detects the presence of ovaries 5x6 cm in size on both sides. The same data were confirmed by ultrasound. Histology reveals a thick fibrous capsule surrounding the ovary that covers numerous cystic follicles, lined with granulosa cells that have a hypertrophied luteal inner membrane (theca). No corpora lutea could be detected. What has caused this condition in the patient?

102. A 55-year-old patient complains of pain in the joints that becomes worse before changes in the weather. Blood tests detect high levels of uric acid. What substance is breaking down, likely causing this condition in the patient?
103. A certain vitamin, as a coenzyme, is a component of glutamic acid decarboxylase, it takes part in GABA formation and its deficiency can cause convulsions. Name this vitamin.

104. Autopsy of the body of a 63-year-old man, who died of lung cancer, detected multiple metastases. What metastases can be classified as implantation (contact) metastases, based on their mechanism of development?

answers.text: A. Invasion of the tumor from the bronchus into the esophagus
C. Metastases into the adrenal glands
D. Metastases into the peribronchial, bifurcation, and paratracheal lymph nodes
E. Small multiple tumor nodules on the pleura

questions.question: 105. Autopsy of the body of a 59-year-old woman, who had a long history of essential hypertension, shows that both her kidneys are dense and significantly reduced in size and have a fine-grained surface. What is indicated by thesechanges?

answers.text: D. Atrophy caused by insufficient blood supply

questions.question: 106. A 50-year-old patient was prescribed ceftriaxone for the10 treatment of typhoid fever. However, the next day the patient's condition deteriorated, the temperature increased to 39.6°C. What has likely caused the deterioration of the patient's condition?

answers.text: A. Effect of the pathogen's endotoxins
D. Addition of a secondary infection

questions.question: 107. A 66-year-old man has been diagnosed with a malignant epithelial tumor originating from a medium-sized bronchus. What epithelium is the source of the tumor development?

108. A patient with an open spinal injury presents with a rupture of the right half of the spinal cord. What type of sensitivity can be expected to disappear only on the side, where the rupture has occurred?
109. After an industrial accident, a man was exposed to the toxic effect of potassium cyanide, which caused a blockade of cytochrome oxidase. What pathological process occurred as a result?

110. A child with von Gierke disease presents with a slowed down growth and enlarged liver and kidneys. In the blood, the glucose levels are reduced, while lipids and uric acid levels are increased. What enzyme is absent in this case, causing this type of glycogenosis?
111. Analysis of the primary structure of a globin molecule revealed that glutamic acid had been replaced with valine. What hereditary pathology is it characteristic of?
112. A 63-year-old patient develops angina pectoris attacks during physical exertion. What group of drugs should be prescribed for their prevention?

113. A patient diagnosed with acute respiratory failure underwent artificial lung ventilation at a high partial pressure of oxygen, as a result of which the patient’s condition became worse and the patient developed a respiratory distress syndrome. What is the likely cause of this complication?

answers.text: A. Intensive oxidation of lung surfactant
E. Blood stasis in the lungs

questions.question: 114. A patient is allergic to pollen. How should the specific hyposensitization of the body be carried out?

answers.text: A. Repeated introduction of small doses of the allergen, with gradually increasing doses
D. Repeated introduction of large doses of the allergen, with gradually reducing doses
E. Administration of an antispasmodic drug

questions.question: 115. A patient with leukemia was prescribed 5-fluorouracil. What is the mechanism of action of this drug?

116. A culture of tumor cells was treated with colchicine that blocks the formation of tubulin proteins that form the division spindle. What stages of the cell cycle will become disturbed as a result?
117. What compound is the end product of purine nucleotide catabolism in the human body?
118. A patient underwent a study of the secretory activity of the stomach to clarify the diagnosis of Achlorhydria. What pathological component of gastric juice can be detected in this case?

119. During repeated exposure to ultraviolet rays, the skin darkens due to the synthesis of melanin in it, which protects cells from damage. What is the primary mechanism that activates this protection?

answers.text: A. Inhibition of homogentisic acid oxidase
D. Activation of homogentisic acid oxidase

questions.question: 120. Examination detected phenyl pyruvic acid in a patient's urine and elevated phenylalanine levels in the blood. The patient was diagnosed with phenylketonuria. What method can be used to confirm this diagnosis?

121. Examination of an 18-year-old girl detects the following: underdeveloped ovaries, broad shoulders, narrow pelvis, shortened legs, "neck of the sphinx", normal mental development. Provisionally, she was diagnosed with Turner syndrome. What method can be used to confirm this pathology?

122. After the introduction of a large dose of antibodies into the glomerular basement membrane of the kidney, the experimental animal developed acute glomerulonephritis. This pathology is based on the following type of allergic reaction according to the Gell-Coombs classification:

123. A young person developed a painless neoplasm without clear boundaries in the soft tissues of the left thigh. A biopsy material of the tissues shows that the neoplasm consists of immature fibroblasts. Make the diagnosis.

124. A few hours after receiving a burn, a focus of necrosis appeared on the skin with hyperemia and edema. What is the main mechanism of intensification of destructive phenomena in the inflammation focus?

125. A 21-year-old patient underwent removal of a tumor in the right frontal lobe of the brain. The tumor was 5 cm in diameter, with a blurry margin between it and the surrounding tissues. It looks uniform on section. Histologically, it consists of stellate cells, the numerous processes of which form dense plexuses. What tumor is it?

126. A 38-year-old man die while trying to lift a weight. Autopsy of the body shows a rupture of an extensive aneurysm of the thoracic aorta. The man had a history of visceral syphilis. What pathological process in this case resulted in the decreased strength of the aortic wall, its distension and rupture?

answers.text: B. Atrophy of the muscular layer

questions.question: 127. An infectionist has detected an acute enterocolitis syndrome with impaired processes of digestion and absorption of breakdown products in the patient. What cells of the intestinal epithelium are damaged, resulting in such disorders?

answers.text: A. Columnar cells with a border
D. Columnar cells without a border

questions.question: 128. A 50-year-old woman developed hemolytic anemia after mushroom poisoning. Where will the hemolysis of erythrocytes primarily occur in this case?

129. Hematologic study of the patient’s blood shows the following pattern: erythrocytes – 2.8 × 10¹²/L, Hb – 80 g/L, color index – 0.85, reticulocytes – 0.1%, platelets – 160 thousand per microliter, leukocytes – 16.0 × 10⁹/L, basophils – 2%, eosinophils – 5%, myelocytes – 5%, juvenile – 16%, band neutrophils – 20%, segmented neutrophils – 25%, lymphocytes – 5%, monocytes – 5%. What blood pathology is indicated by these findings?

130. In a patient, the duration of the PQ interval in the ECG exceeds the norm, while the duration of the P wave remains normal. This phenomenon is caused by a decreased speed of excitation conduction in a certain structure. Name this structure.

131. In the admission room of a hospital, material samples are being taken for bacteriological testing. What is the purpose of taking a material sample from a patient with a purulent lesion of the deep tissues of the leg?

answers.text: A. Establishing the etiology of the purulent process and determining the sensitivity to antibiotics
B. Confirmation of the diagnosis of anaerobic infection
D. Identification of the pathogen to prevent a nosocomial infection
E. Identification of the pathogenic staphylococcus and determining the antibiotic resistance profile

questions.question: 132. In some diseases, changes occur in the cells, with lysosomal membrane integrity becoming impaired in the process. What changes will occur in the cells as a result?
133. What changes in hemocoagulation processes will occur in a person, if activity of the sympathetic nervous system increases?

134. A 56-year-old patient complains of an acute pain attack in the area of the right ankle joint. Objectively, the joint is hyperemic, edematous, and hot to the touch. The levels of uric acid in the blood are elevated. For the treatment of this pathology, the doctor prescribed a drug that inhibits xanthine oxidase. What drug is it?
135. A patient has a head injury, accompanied by arterial bleeding in the area of the parietal bone. What branch of the external carotid artery supplies this area with blood?

136. Familial hypercholesterolemia was detected during the examination of a teenager with xanthomatosis. In this pathology, a significantly increased concentration of certain lipoproteins can be observed in the blood. Name these lipoproteins.

137. Gluconeogenesis reactions use phosphoenolpyruvate formed from oxaloacetate. Oxaloacetate is synthesized by pyruvate carboxylase in mitochondria. What shuttle system transports this metabolite into the cytoplasm?
138. A patient was diagnosed with an esophageal foreign body, located at the level of the fourth thoracic vertebra. In which anatomic constriction of the esophagus did the foreign body stop?
139. Laboratory testing detects glucose in the urine of an 18-year-old patient, while glucose levels in the patient’s blood plasma are normal. What is the likely cause of this disorder?
140. During childbirth, the woman developed secondary weakness of labor activity. What drug must be administered in this case to restore the contractile activity of the myometrium?

141. Examination of a man detects skin calcification, Raynaud syndrome, an esophageal motility disorder, sclerodactyly, and telangiectasia. These changes are called CREST syndrome and are characteristic of the following disease:
142. A patient with chronic hepatitis presents with a significant decrease in the synthesis and secretion of bile acids. What process would be most disturbed in the intestine of this patient?
143. Examination of the cells of the buccal mucosa obtained from a woman detected no sex chromatin. What medical condition is likely in this case?

144. Bioactive substances hormones are produced as a result of hydrolysis and modification of certain proteins. What protein in the pituitary gland is the source of lipotropin, corticotropin, melanotropin, and endorphin?

145. After a maxillofacial injury, a 40-year-old man developed a dysfunction of the sublingual and submandibular glands on the left. Hyposalivation is observed in the affected glands. What nerve does not function properly in this case?
146. A woman gave birth to a stillborn child with maldevelopments. What protozoan disease could have caused the intrauterine infection of the fetus?
147. Arachidonic acid as an irreplaceable component of diet is a precursor of bioactive substances. What compounds can be synthesized from this acid?

148. A 6-year-old child developed hyperergic inflammation of the upper respiratory tracts. The risk of developing a severe respiratory disorder arose, necessitating the use of anti-inflammatory hormones. What hormone has an anti-inflammatory effect?
